==Events==
*  [[68]] &ndash; The [[Roman Senate]] proclaims [[Galba]] as emperor.
* [[218]] &ndash; [[Battle of Antioch (218)|Battle of Antioch]]: with the support of the Syrian [[Roman legion|legions]], [[Elagabalus]] defeats the forces of emperor [[Macrinus]]. He flees, but is captured near [[Chalcedon]] and later executed in [[Cappadocia]].
* [[632]] &ndash; [[Muhammad]], Islamic [[prophet]], dies in [[Medina]] and is succeeded by [[Abu Bakr]] who becomes the first [[caliph]] of the [[Rashidun Caliphate]].
* [[793]] &ndash; [[Vikings]] raid the abbey at [[Lindisfarne]] in [[Northumbria]], commonly accepted as the beginning of the Scandinavian invasion of [[England]].
*[[1042]] &ndash; [[Edward the Confessor]] becomes King of England, one of the last Anglo-Saxon kings of England.
*[[1191]] &ndash; [[Richard I]] arrives in [[Acre, Israel|Acre]] ([[Palestine]]) thus beginning his crusade.
*[[1405]] &ndash; [[Richard le Scrope]], the [[Archbishop of York]], and [[Thomas de Mowbray, 4th Earl of Norfolk|Thomas Mowbray]], [[Earl of Norfolk]], are executed in [[York]] on [[Henry IV of England|Henry IV]]'s orders.
*[[1690]] &ndash; Yadi Sakat, a Siddi general, razes the [[Mazagon Fort]] in Mumbai.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Trois-Rivières]] &ndash; [[United States|American]] attackers are driven back at [[Trois-Rivières, Quebec]].
*[[1783]] &ndash; [[Laki]], a [[volcano]] in [[Iceland]], begins an eight-month eruption which kills over 9,000 people and starts a seven-year [[famine]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[James Madison]] introduces twelve proposed [[List of amendments to the United States Constitution|amendments to the United States Constitution]] in the [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]]; by 1791, ten of them are [[Ratification|ratified]] by the [[State legislature (United States)|state legislatures]] and become the [[United States Bill of Rights|Bill of Rights]]; another is eventually ratified in 1992 to become the [[Twenty-seventh Amendment to the United States Constitution|27th Amendment]].
*[[1794]] &ndash; [[Maximilien Robespierre|Robespierre]] inaugurates the [[French Revolution]]'s new state religion, the [[Cult of the Supreme Being]], with large organized festivals all across [[France]].
*[[1856]] &ndash; A group of 194 [[Pitcairn Islands|Pitcairn Islanders]], descendants of the mutineers of {{HMS|Bounty}}, arrives at [[Norfolk Island]], commencing the Third Settlement of the Island.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Tennessee]] secedes from the [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Cross Keys]] &ndash; [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] forces under [[General]] [[Stonewall Jackson]] save the [[Army of Northern Virginia]] from a Union assault on the James Peninsula led by [[General]] [[George B. McClellan]].
*[[1887]] &ndash; [[Herman Hollerith]] applies for US [[patent]] #395,791 for the 'Art of Applying Statistics' – his [[punched card]] [[calculator]]. 
*[[1906]] &ndash; [[Theodore Roosevelt]] signs the [[Antiquities Act]] into law, authorizing the [[President of the United States|President]] to restrict the use of certain parcels of [[public land]] with historical or conservation value.
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[Carl Laemmle]] incorporates [[Universal Studios|Universal Pictures]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Second Northern Expedition]]: The [[National Revolutionary Army]] captures [[Peking]], whose name is changed to [[Beijing]] ("Northern Capital").
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[Margaret Bondfield]] is appointed [[Secretary of State for Employment|Minister of Labour]].  She is the first woman appointed to the [[Cabinet of the United Kingdom]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: the completion of [[Operation Alphabet]], the evacuation of Allied forces from [[Narvik]] at the end of the [[Norwegian Campaign]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] [[Syria-Lebanon Campaign|invade]] [[Syria]] and [[Lebanon]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Japan]]ese imperial submarines [[Japanese submarine I-21|I-21]] and I-24 shell the [[Australia]]n cities of [[Sydney]] and [[Newcastle, New South Wales|Newcastle]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Milton Berle]] hosts the debut of ''[[Texaco Star Theater]].''
*[[1949]] &ndash; The celebrities [[Helen Keller]], [[Dorothy Parker]], [[Danny Kaye]], [[Fredric March]], [[John Garfield]], [[Paul Muni]] and [[Edward G. Robinson]] are named in an [[Federal Bureau of Investigation|FBI]] report as [[Communist Party]] members.
*  1949   &ndash; [[George Orwell]]'s ''[[Nineteen Eighty-Four]]'' is published.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[Sir]] [[Thomas Blamey]] becomes the only Australian-born [[Field Marshal]] in Australian history.
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[1953 Flint–Beecher tornado|An F5 tornado]] hits [[Beecher, Michigan]], killing 116, injuring 844, and destroying 340 homes. 
*  1953   &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]] rules that restaurants in [[Washington, D.C.]], cannot refuse to serve black patrons.
*[[1959]] &ndash; The {{USS|Barbero|SS-317|6}} and [[United States Postal Service]] attempt the delivery of mail via [[Missile Mail]].
*[[1966]] &ndash; An [[F-104 Starfighter]] collides with [[XB-70 Valkyrie]] prototype no. 2, destroying both planes during a photo shoot near [[Edwards Air Force Base]]. [[Joseph A. Walker]], a [[NASA]] pilot, and Carl Cross, a [[United States Air Force]] test pilot, are both killed.
*  1966   &ndash; [[Topeka, Kansas]], is devastated by a tornado that registers as an "F5" on the [[Fujita Scale]]: the first to exceed US$100&nbsp;million in damages. Sixteen people are killed, hundreds more injured, and thousands of homes damaged or destroyed.
*[[1967]] &ndash; [[Six-Day War]]: The [[USS Liberty incident|USS ''Liberty'' incident]] occurs, killing 34 and wounding 171.
*  1967   &ndash; Six-Day War: The Israeli army enters [[Hebron]] and the [[Cave of the Patriarchs]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Robert F. Kennedy]]'s funeral takes place at the [[Basilica of St. Patrick's Cathedral, New York City]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Associated Press]] photographer [[Nick Ut]] takes his [[Pulitzer Prize]]-winning photo of a naked 9-year-old [[Phan Thị Kim Phúc]] running down a road after being burned by [[napalm]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Bluff Cove Air Attacks]] during the [[Falklands War]]: 56 British servicemen are killed by an [[Argentine]] air attack on two landing ships, [[RFA Sir Galahad|RFA ''Sir Galahad'']] and [[RFA Sir Tristram|RFA ''Sir Tristram'']].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Homosexuality]] is declared legal in the [[States and territories of Australia|Australian state]] of [[New South Wales]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[New Zealand]]'s [[New Zealand Labour Party|Labour]] government establishes a [[New Zealand's nuclear-free zone|national nuclear-free zone]] under the [[New Zealand Nuclear Free Zone, Disarmament, and Arms Control Act 1987]].
*[[1992]] &ndash; The first [[World Ocean Day]] is celebrated, coinciding with the [[Earth Summit]] held in [[Rio de Janeiro]], [[Brazil]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; The downed [[U.S. Air Force]] pilot [[Captain (United States)|Captain]] [[Scott O'Grady]] is rescued by [[U.S. Marines]] in [[Bosnia and Herzegovina|Bosnia]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; The first [[Transit of Venus, 2004|Venus Transit]] in modern history takes place, the previous one being in [[1882]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Newcastle, New South Wales]], [[Australia]], is hit by the State's worst storms and flooding in 30 years resulting in the death of nine people and the grounding of a trade ship, the {{MV|Pasha Bulker}}.
*[[2009]] &ndash; Two American [[journalist]]s are [[2009 imprisonment of American journalists by North Korea|found guilty]] of illegally entering [[North Korea]] and sentenced to 12 years of [[penal labour]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[Wedding of Princess Madeleine of Sweden and Christopher O'Neill]] takes place in [[Stockholm]], Sweden.
